clinical_study.brief_title: Activity Trackers for Monitoring During Rehabilitation After Total Knee Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Activity Trackers for Monitoring During Rehabilitation After Total Knee Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to estimated the change of the steps of daily life of osteoarthritis patients before and in 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year after the total knee arthroplasty (TKA) through a kind of activity tracker: Fitbit ONE.

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 100 participants who will receive total knee arthroplasty will be recruited in this study. Fitbit ONE, the activity tracker, will be used for all of them to monitor the daily steps during the rehabilitation, to be exact, before and at 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year after TKA. Moreover, pain score, self reported questionnaire will also be estimated at those time points.

primary_outcome.measure: The change of steps of daily life
primary_outcome.time_frame: before operation and 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year after operation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before operation and 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year after operation
secondary_outcome.description: Visual Analogue Scale of pain is a scale to estimate pain, and its score ranges from 0 to 10. The higher the score is, the more severe pain the patient is feeling.

secondary_outcome.measure: The change of knee joint symptoms.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: before operation and 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year after operation
secondary_outcome.description: The Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Osteoarthritis Index(WOMAC),and its score ranges from 0 to 96. The higher the score is, the more severe symptoms the patient is feeling.

arm_group.description: In this study, Fitbit One, the activity tracker, will be used for every participants to evaluate the daily steps before and after surgery for one year

intervention.description: Activity tracker, Fitbit One, will be used for a week to evaluate the steps of daily life before the surgery and at the time of follow up.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ready to receive single-side TKA
Exclusion Criteria:
- contraindication of surgery
- self-reported diseases that cause lower limb disability (for example, cerebrovascular disease especially stroke)
